title: A. Friendly Numbers
statement:
For an integer $$$x$$$, we call another integer $$$y$$$
friendly
if the following condition holds:
$$$y - d(y) = x$$$, where $$$d(y)$$$ is the sum of the digits of $$$y$$$.
For a given integer $$$x$$$, determine how many
friendly
numbers it has.
inputSpecification:
Input
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 500$$$). The description of the test cases follows.
Each test case consists of a single line containing one integer $$$x$$$ ($$$1 \le x \le 10^{9}$$$).
outputSpecification:
Output
For each test case, output one integer — the answer to the problem.
